pro_critic_reviews.summary: The film’s finely tuned middle act, a fast-paced and quick-witted journey into (possible) madness, eventually gives way to an unsettlingly over the top final section that relies far too much on larger setpieces and supposed “big scares” that are never as good as the smaller, weirder stuff.
For sheer craftsmanship, As Above, So Below is the type of horror film you should see theatrically. It's really well-made, even if it ends up feeling a little familiar by the end.
Novel enough to be worth the price of admission, but you'll think twice before getting back in line for a second visit.
One of the world's top disturbing tourist attractions is now finally getting the spooky film it deserves
Boasts sporadically electrifying visuals but a frustratingly messy mythology.
What’s the point in shooting a horror movie in the catacombs if it’s just going to end up looking like every horror movie not shot in the catacombs?
As Above, So Below is sometimes creepy but mostly silly, which is too bad because the film's cramped subterranean setting is inherently unnerving.
Like other movies of its ilk, it's missing a very simple bit of next-level Hollywood technology: a tripod.

It offers a handful of effective moments and some characters that are fun to watch squirm through muck and bones, but not much more than that, especially when the films spins out of control towards its conclusion.
The film predictably alternates in scaring its characters by tapping into their deepest fears and having them rub shoulders with the relics of a past that insists on being undisturbed.
It all makes for clumsy-fun escapism, not bad as end-of-summer chillers go.
While its characters attempt to go deeper, As Above/So Below’s stabs at scares and sentiment only seem that much shallower.
There are moments of welcome tension amid the inchoate lunacy, but these in turn merely highlight why the rest of the film doesn’t work.
There are some interestingly contrived moments of claustrophobia and surreal lunacy, but this cliched and slightly hand-me-down script neither scares nor amuses very satisfyingly.

These catacombs are just an echo chamber into which any rubbish can be pumped, and while this gives carte blanche to production designer Louise Marzaroli, the relentless flow of subterranean non-sequitur becomes at least as trying as the whirling, jerky non-cinematography.
It’s more unpleasant than scary, and ever so slow in getting up to speed.
As Above, So Below is inherently absurd, but it would be somewhat less so had it fully committed to just one of its ridiculous premises.

As Above/So Below purposefully generates a certain air of mystery by keeping the exact nature of its protagonists’ experience enigmatic, but for a film that takes place underground in tightly enclosed spaces, it’s surprisingly thin on suspense and palpable physical danger.
This quivering effort from the director John Erick Dowdle only increases in impenetrability whenever anything mildly curious occurs.

It's clear from the start that Dowdle isn't taking any of this seriously. The same cannot be said for the game and luckless cast of young actors, who are so whiny and hysterical right from the start of their plunge into the tombs that they win hearty unintentional laughs throughout.

This low budget effort from director John Erick Dowdle and writer-producer-brother Drew Dowdle provides a few late scares after plenty of eye-rolling setup, with said scares due more to the heavy sound design than the action itself.
As forewarned, so avoid.
An entertainment-free sinkhole of Dramamine-worthy nonsense.

user_reviews.text: Not bad at all for a found footage film. It only lost me slightly around the halfway mark when the literal happenings gave way to the fantastical. I do think the cast was pretty fun to watch.

If you think hating on this movie is worth while, then you're wasting your time.  This movie isn't some groundbreaking piece of found footage horror.  It's important to go into a movie like this open minded, not intent on finding any and every fault you can possible pick out of it.  If you do that, go home.  That being said, this movie is awesome.  It gives a very serious, tense look at the research and exploring leading up to a dive into frightening caverns lined with human bones.  It gives us back story and as much characterization as it needs to make it scary.  You know the leading lady is determined to respect her father's life's work and she's surrounded by reluctant, loyal, or knowledgeable companions.  Seriously, they're going into bone-tunnels to hell.  It's obvious.  Don't take this movie for more than what it is.  Once they get down there and the scares start coming, there's no need for any of it, and no need to nit pick.  From hooded figures to a crazed lost friend to things being upside down and carved into the rock, this movie delivers the scares perfectly, though they are measured.  You have to be a little patient.

If you like horror movies you'll like this movie.  If you don't like horror movies you probably won't like it.  The plot becomes a little nonsensical at the end but if you can suspend disbelief it's a lot of fun and creepy and suspenseful throughout.

The movie has some very good idea's but they are not very well presented and do really feel like a good fit for a found footage movie. The cast do an excellent job for the most part with only a couple of slightly awkward and poorly acted scenes.

I don't understand why all the negative reviews. This movie was a hell of a ride!! It was fun and very well shot for the low-budget that it is. I was surprised that i was into it from the start despite knowing what I was in for. The script gets more interesting as the movie goes further down (wink! wink!) As long as you're not expecting academy award quality, you will have a great time. I will definitely be on the look out for future works from the director.

I went into this with 0 expectations and a fear of this being just another run of the mill generic Descent rip off with found footage. The director of this however directed my favorite found footage film of all time which is "The Poughkeepsie Tapes". I walked out actually having enjoyed and I was also a little shaken up. This movie starts out really slow and really not all that interesting but once the crew of characters enter the catacombs this movie really picked up. It had some genuinely creep scares as well as some very unsettling sounds and imagery. This is another rare case of good acting in horror movie. This movie had all the way up until the end. The end was a cheap anti-climactic abrupt end with nothing even remotely explaining what the hell we just watched. No Clues! Nothing! Even Under the Skin (one of my favorites of this year) a nearly silent film left subtle visual hints at what was going on. This has nothing! Slow beginning, bad end but great middle with some seriously chilling scares and an outstanding visit visit from an old friend (The Grim Reaper). If you are a die hard fan of Horror movies you will most likely enjoy this.

I absolutely love this movie, its allot better than I expected, I don’t understand why it didn’t do well critically. I would best describe this movie as a mix of GRAVE ENCOUNTERS and NATIONAL TREASURE. It’s probably one of the most original horror movies I’ve seen in recent times. It mixes perfectly elements of Historical-Mystery- Adventure and Horror in one.

It succeeds enough to be entertaining with what it has; which is something one should expect with this kind of horror film, but would have been more satisfying if we didn't have to deal with nauseating camera movements and prolonged scenes of footage faced at the wall.
Featuring some good performances from its main cast and a creepy atmosphere, "As Above, So Below", unfortunately, is weighed down by a cliché-ridden narrative and a weak premise.

I enjoyed As Above, So Below far more than a six. I was entertained throughout the whole movie. I was very interested in the travel while in the underground caves. Visually it is so interesting. There are a few real good scares as well and I also enjoyed the cast. However, there are a lot of holes in the plot. There are a lot of questions left unanswered. The movie just has plot twist every few minutes without any warning or reason and in the ending there is still no explanation. I did really enjoy the movie but its hard to give it a better grade than six considering there are so many questions that remain unanswered. I may have to watch this movie again just to see if I can pick up more from it. There are people who will love this movie but there will also be many who will hate it.

I hate to admit it but this found footage film was a success, with an stimulating plot, believable character's to an extent especially on the protagonist's part, the film gripped me with heavy tension and psychological suspense for the majority of the runtime thanks to the eerie atmosphere and jump scares that actually worked As above so below had me on the edge of my seat.

If you like horror movies you best look elsewhere this movie was both disappointing and a waste of money. The movie took too long to get to the climax, when it started to get there there wasn't much time left for there to be any climax, then when there was I was very disappointed with the following scenes as there was very little horror. Also the trailer gives most of the jump scared away. Don't waste your time or money on this movie.

Much better than I imagined it would be.  I enjoyed the intro sequence in the Iranian tunnel system, and the lead actress is an excellent casting choice.  Further, the guy from Mad Men brings some acting skill to the proceedings. It's a nice set-up, and an interesting final minute, but the final third as a whole gets fairly pedestrian for the genre.  I'd still recommend this to people, like me, who have been in the Parisian Catacombs and may have been a little freaked out by them.

As Above, So Below has the premise to be a great horror film on paper but sadly on the screen just signals the death of a genre made popular by ‘The Blair Witch Project’  some 15 years ago. Do you want to make a film but can’t be arsed? Then make a shaky-cam film as there is little or no skill required to produce an hour and a half of headache inducing wobbly action. Starting in Iran before moving to the catacombs of Paris the camera work is so frenetic that I couldn’t make out what the hell I was looking at most of the time it certainly didn’t deliver on the promise of the great setting as this could have been any old cave by the time they finally get round to going there, and that’s the films main problem it’s just dull and drawn out. I’ve been to the catacombs (one of the reasons I went to see this film) and it is a quite scary place, the person I was with had a panic attack and yet none of this comes across in the film and this is before it spirals down into a mess of supernatural mumbo jumbo which just makes the last portion of the movie laughable. Plucky brit Lara wannabe Scarlett leads her team in to the caves like a poor man’s Descent, two of her party are clearly only there to be killed off and may as well of worn a red Star Trek top each from the outset. Once inside they quest for a magic stone that has the ability to heal you if you get hurt therefore removing any suspense that might have been left in this vacuous borefest. All it took to make this film is any old cave, a group of models and a handful of Go-Pros and a way of reducing the majesty and history of the Paris catacombs into nothing more than a gimmicky footnote to get people in to the cinema.

This pretty good premise had promise until the **** ending. The movie was good until it tried too hard to be unique. The movie is actually one of the better unofficial "found footage" genre movies, sadly. The beginning has it's flaws, but the pace and story of the stone is actually pretty well done. There's this stone called "Philosophers Stone" (KIND of a copy of Harry Potter) that is suppose to basically heal and give the owner internal life....basically harry potter. Scarlet finds out that the stone is in Paris and they go after it. Well this is where things are actually pretty good. Creepy things happen in the Catacombs. The good thing about this movie is the one fact that plague a lot of found footage movies "why are you still filming". They move the camera onto a head light, like a go camera. So "still filming" doesn't go through the audience's minds...well that's a small good thing about the movie. After half way through the movie, the story of the stone is quite stupid and turns into a backwards and confusing premise....that's really awkwardly pretentious. Its nothing to watch in theaters....just watch it on Netflix when it arrive there in the future...just don't stay for the ending. Overall I didn't thing it was god awful, but the movie is too confusing and pretentious for its own good. 5.8

I believe that by many people, this film has been unfairly reviewed. I went to to see it on Saturday and thoroughly enjoyed it. It had a very good story which kept you on edge until the end. It had plenty of jump scares which I expect from a horror film and the actresses and actors were chosen perfectly for their roles. If anyone has been put off by negative reviews, I would suggest going to see the movie for yourself and making your own judgement.

¿En serio? una película de terror en una cueva donde a lo unico que le temen son a sus traumas? ¿de donde viene eso? la película es una tontería, no se explica, la trama es super sencilla, un grupo de personas va a explorar una cueva en busca de tesoros (la piedra filosofal) y resulta que esta maldita, ¿razones? ni idea, las muertes, los efectos, las actuaciones, el maquillaje, la fotografía... TODO PÉSIMO, no se entiende, aburre, los screamers son tontos, sin chiste, no asustan ni dan miedo, la claustrofobia que me tendría que dar no surge.

A young team ventures deep in the catacombs under Paris in quest of secret treasure. The first hour sets up a mildly interesting mystery/adventure, but when the "horror" finally arrives, the film deteriorates into scream scares and creepy stuff that's dumb and obscure. The filmmaker also uses the found footage approach (a la "Blair Witch Project" & "Paranormal Activity"), which I find a challenging but cheesy way to tell a story.

I would rather be eaten by goats than be forced to subject myself to this film again. Basically, a magic pseudo-superwoman named Scarlett who, somehow, has 2 PhDs and a Master's Degree by the time she's roughly 30 and can solve any riddle in a matter of 30 seconds, tries to unearth the mythical Philosopher's Stone. Of course, she also has the capability to solve any problem the plot may throw at her, from lock-picking to whatever else the writer cared to dream up. The story is non-existent, the repetitive jump scares are thoroughly boring, and the over-acting is hilariously bad in parts. Avoid this film as if it were the Black Death, as it's arguably even worse than that.

Don't waste the $9. Awful Blair Witch-type shake cam footage leaves it nearly impossible to watch, let alone figure out what is happening. I'm unsure as to how anyone on metacritic could give this a good review, maybe they are all the actors and crew?

Stupid horror movies are boring; this one isn't stupid. It tries to establish its own mythology and sticks to it. Though the mythos isn't the best thing since sliced bread, I did appreciate the filmmakers giving it their best shot. This film is like a terrifying version of the abyss shot with headcams. They just keep going deeper and deeper into the depths of the underworld and it's a wild ride. It's worth watching once. I watched "sinister" last night, and in contrast, this flick was worlds better. The monsters were actually scary instead of some idiot wearing a tuxedo. Don't listen to people giving as above so below 0 scores because they obviously aren't bright enough to recognize what a real scary movie should be like.
The same horror movie tricks every F*****g movie for the last 20 years! they need to lay off the indistry for a few years and come up with a GOOD idea AND story.

I liked how everything you thought it would be about completely flew away. All the assumptions of Zombies or spirits that I had for this film were pretty far off. It turned into something much more along the lines of Mythical. Acting was decent, visuals were stunning, the pace of the film kept you in it the whole time. There were some honestly terrifying instances; and I'm not even talking about the jump scares. As Above, So Below has been written off as "just another found footage film" but the problem with that is most found-footage films needn't be so. It actually makes sense for these people to have cameras on their heads because they're searching for something completely unimaginable. Overall it's a solid film with great dynamics and some great scares that are none too cheap.

Gripping, scary movie, photogenic leads with great chemistry, fascinating settings - what's not to like? Saw this movie twice and would see it again. Weirdly scared me more on second viewing. Underrated in my view. See it.
This is a very good movie. The lead female character is great. The supporting cast is very strong, particularly the French crew.

A truly engrossing Uncharted-meets-Indiana-Jones-esque setup is completely subverted by laughably bungled horror scenes and a series of plot developments that ultimately leave more questions about the narrative than answers.

There's really not much to say on this one. Overall, it's just another cliché-riddled found footage film, which is disappointing, considering how much I was anticipating it, as well as its intriguing premise. Granted, there were a few intense moments here and there, but for the most part it felt kinda clumsy. Just rent it once if you're planning on watching it.
Another moronic so-called found footage film . Hideous storyline and bad acting . Don't even go that below as the film is horrid. Stay away and watch something else.

This trend of the handheld "found footage" sub genre has got to end!  What was highly innovative and very influential starting with "The Blair Witch Project" has become a way for the studios to put out severely substandard fare and market and sell it as if it were on the level of real motion pictures as we've always known them, when in fact the product is not only not worth the price of admission but not even worthy of being in theaters at all.

As Above So Below is a decent incarnation of the book it was based off of, Legion of Dwellers. The key difference between As Above So Below and Legion of Dwellers, is that the book was written toward a young adult audience, and it probably won't disappoint you in the end. Go here to view the similarities. theplaintivepoet.blogspot (As Above So Below verse Legion of Dwellers)

This movie was so bad , the visuals were actually decent but the acting was horrid the story was terrible its the same trick for every horror movie for the last 20 years " oh its safe * turn around every corner* " boo" it was as scary as the telly tubbies.
I liked it. Not the best movie ever but still entertaining.

Found footage. Claustrophobia/cave. Gregorian. The main character, a wealthy white woman doctoral student who says she has a black belt in Krav Maga (i.e. Lara Croft but as a horror protagonist) survives. That's all you need to know; you can fill in the blanks now.
So i was reading some of the users reviews and thought to myself. Let just try the movie.

this is the most boring and non-scary low budget  movie I have ever seen..... So glad I didn't have to pay to go see this movie in the theater If you like horror movies you'll  probably won't like it. The plot is  nonsensical
Thoroughly enjoyed this movie. Had very tense and gripping moments.

This is one of the scariest and most entertaining found footage movies (other than [REC]). It has an overall sense of dread from the very beginning. The story and how they are hoping to get out of the catacombs is also interesting, and the ending is probably the coolest part. There is stuff that has been seen before in found footage movies, but there's enough new material to keep it interesting and fresh. If you're a found footage fan, I definitely recommend it.

With characters on the hunt for a legendary historical artifact and solving ancient puzzles by deciphering dead languages and using their historical knowledge, it makes for a better Indiana Jones type film than it does a horror film. Even the lead actress Perdita Weeks makes for a compelling Lara Croft type given here characters knowledge, determination, and accent. It's these elements that make the film compelling, but the horror elements give it the extra something weird to make it unique.

A horror that starts out decent and had great character development but leaves you with an ending that will have you scratching your head and questioning the rest of what you just watched.  Don't get me wrong; the movie was fun to watch at the start, and the scares you really great, but once reaches the climax you aren't left or given much of an explanation and will have any fans of 'Bill and Teds Bogus Journey' convinced that this movie completely ripped off their interpretation of Death.  It really did fell like the writers just didn't know how to end, what was up until then, a decent horror flick.  A good watch for those that just like to be scared and don't care much for story, but any horror fan will be throwing their popcorn at the screen once the credits start to roll.
To the people who said they are stick and tried of found footage movies, well your not alone.
To me, it was not that overwhelmingly bad, I like the location it takes place in and the scares were on-fleek. It would've helped if the movie had more scares.

This movie came out of nowhere. All of a sudden, a lot of people started talking about it. As per usual, the opinions varied between the two sides of the spectrum - the eternal love/hate attitude towards found footage horror (FFH) movies was present and strong with this one. Which meant I had to see it.

i am a big fan of horror but i never seen any horror masterpiece like as above so below. this movie was boring at first but then it get interesting very interesting!  but it is  a disaster full of idiots in a horror as always but omfg this movie has jump thrills and scares also i never knew that this was actually one of the best scary things i have ever seen on the big screen also it's one of the best of the year's  horror films. Did i mention that it is one better then Paranormal Activity movies.   Shaky cam thats what that i hate about horror documentary's but is writers  John Erick Dowdle and Drew Dowdle trying to make this movie like their previous horror suspense , toxic pool " Quarantine"  ? yes the shaky cam indeed the story much different.

A tablet written in Aramaic happens to rhyme in English when translated... yea, not a lot of brains went into this movie but for a lost footage horror film it is still one of the better ones which does say much since I have yet to see one that I like. The acting was terrible, and the banter was uninteresting and mostly distracting, but some of the horror ideas were not too bad. Sure they implemented a few jump scares and other cliches but once the movie gets going you cant help but cheer for the cave to kill everyone... not I am not kidding. You actually want them all to die because they are beyond stupid but the upside is you start to think of the cave as being alive in its own right. That is what makes it interesting. Most haunted house type movies do a pathetic job of making ghosts or monsters come alive but this one does it inadvertently.
Despite the valiant attempts of a fairly talented cast of good looking but unknown actors, the only thing this movie proves to be is a mind numbing decent into claustrophobia.
Lot of potential there, some pretty good moments here and there, but mostly they waste a great concept on cheap jumpscares and loud sounds like most of the horror films these days...

This movie is genuinely scary. Yes, the myology needs to be cleaned up a bit but many times this movie stunned and left me holding my breath multiple times. The movie doesn't rely on cheap jump scares, it also will leave you feeling creeped out. What I like most about this movie though is that its not just some stupid horror movie, it requires you to think. Believe me, go and see it
This movie is awesome! It is really interesting that they shot this in the actual catacombs and not like the 2009 movie.

Horror movies these days are often few well done and the rest are all cliched pieces of crap. This film is not one of those, its one of its own genre and that genre is called: AMAZING. This had amazing acting, scares, and superb storytelling.
Sporadically scary and emotionally engaging.

This was a really great movie. I'm a fan of the director, and I've loved all his films. This is a disturbing scary movie, and everyone should really watch it. Don't pay attention to the critics score, watch the film. It's really good

OK, i rated this before. But i did not do it justly. It didnt deserve an 8 score or 7 and barely a six. Actually, it doesnt even deserve a six either. More like a 3 or 4. It goes so slow in the beginning I'm suprised i didn't die of old age. the back stories of all of the characters are cheesy (get it? Cuz' they're from france? Heh? HahahaHAHAHAH where's my cyanide!?)  and the scaryness of it all? not there, kinda almost creepy-ish is the closest it comes, and most characters were bland and boring (save papillion and souxie) and as sone as they die, so does the movie. They were the dim almost kindling light that kept the deep catacombs slightly entertaining and creepy. It was a terrible goody goody happy ending and all of the wrong characters died and survived. the only reason im giving it a 6 and not a 3 is because i have a strange affection to it. despite its many many many (x Infinity) flaws.
